p: Such materials include solid solutions (SS) and compounds formed in the binary system (1- x) NaNbO 3 – xCa 2Nb 2O 7, where 0 ≤ х ≤ 1. The interest to this system is piqued by the fact that its last components demonstrate some practically important properties. Sodium niobate is an antiferroelectric, and is used as a basis for environmentally friendly (lead-free) industrial piezoceramics. Calcium pyroniobate is a ferroelectric with a Curie temperature above 1800 K [ 2]. It is considered as a promising compound for non-linear optics [ 3] and laser technology [ 4]. In addition, Ca 2Nb 2O 7 is a highly active photocatalyst for water splitting under UV light irradiation [ 5, 6].
